Okanagan 48 Hour Film Project presents

PREMIERE SCREENING & BEST-OF AWARDS


Lights, Camera, Action: The Ultimate Film Showdown!

Get ready to immerse yourself in the magic of cinema as we proudly present the Okanagan 48 Hour Film Project Screening Night! Be among the first to witness the cinematic brilliance of these short films, all brought to life by local filmmakers in a heart-pounding 48-hour race against the clock.

Learn more about the Okanagan 48 Hour Film Project - okgn48.ca

htmlDescription:
Geek SOS Services Ltd. presents

A ROCKY MOUNTAIN HIGH CHRISTMAS


Rocky Mountain High is back, this time with "A Rocky Mountain High Christmas" – an enchanting blend of John Denver's beloved hits and festive Christmas tunes, tailor-made for the holiday season!

Returning to Kelowna for a single magical performance, this production features Canadian recording artists Rick and Steve Worrall, with special guests soprano Melina Schein, tenor Chad Abrahamson, Glen Rosa Middle School Choir, Delphine Litke and Creator’s Impact Performance Company, plus a stellar Canadian all-star band, and a symphony ensemble from across Canada.

Join in the joyous sing-along as we revisit all the timeless John Denver classics and cherished Christmas melodies from his TV special with the Muppets and his "Rocky Mountain Christmas" album.

This event is a true homage to John's music, steering clear of impersonations and instead spotlighting his incomparable songs. Featuring the arrangements of long-time friend and arranger/conductor Lee Holdridge, the focus remains squarely on the music itself.

Critics rave about the show:

* "For the Love of John Denver... Amazing!" – Calgary Herald  
* "An absolute must-see!" – Global TV Toronto  
* "A spectacular evening of great music... Every tribute show should be like this  one!" – The Daily Courier

This special holiday treat promises an unforgettable and heartwarming experience, guaranteed to be the talk of the town for years to come. Don't miss out on this extraordinary seasonal celebration!

Pricing

P1 $75.50 ($65.00 base price + $2.10 CIF + $8.40 service charge)
P2 $54.45 ($45.00 base price + $2.10 CIF + $7.35 service charge)

All above prices are in CAD and include GST.


---

Kelowna Community Theatre event tickets include a $2.00 Capital Improvement Fee (CIF) and 5% GST. A service fee is added for box office costs, card processing, and taxes. A Rocky Mountain High Christmas tickets and service fees are non-refundable.
name: A Rocky Mountain High Christmas

htmlDescription:
Ballet Kelowna presents

Cikilaxʷm: Controlled Burn

May 1 + 2, 2026

Friday at 7:30 PM/ Saturday at 1:30 PM and 7:30 PM


Ballet Kelowna gratefully acknowledges our 2025/26 season sponsor:
The Thomas Alan Budd Foundation.

Choreography: Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe
Composer: Cris Derksen
Projection and Lighting Design: Andy Moro
Costume Design: Asa Benally

Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe returns with his newest work for the company, Cikilaxʷm: Controlled Burn, a full-length narrative ballet that blazes across time and tradition and is set to original commissioned music by Cree cellist and composer Cris Derksen. Projections by Euro/Omushkego Cree artist Andy Moro will bring to life sterile cities and scorched forests, while costumes by Navajo/Cherokee designer Asa Benally layer each character with rich histories.

Set in a dystopian future where wildfire season has no end, a young Indigenous firefighter’s beliefs are challenged when he meets Mothkʷ, a fierce protector of ancestral knowledge who carries out cultural burns.

The word cikilaxʷm [tseekiLAHkwum] means “prescribed fire” in nsyilxcən, the language belonging to the syilx (Okanagan) People. It relates to traditional burning practices that nourish the land and community, bringing healing and rejuvenation.

“This is not a tale of apocalypse, but of perseverance.
Of memory that survives and endures.
Of land that remembers how to heal.”
- Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe

Developed in collaboration with the National Creation Fund at Canada’s National Arts Centre.

Subscriptions on sale until November 8, 2025.

Ballet Kelowna tickets and their applicable fees are non-refundable.

---

htmlDescription:
Ballet Kelowna presents

COUNTERMOVE

November 7 + 8, 2025
Friday at 7:30 PM / Saturday at 1:30 PM and 7:30 PM


Ballet Kelowna gratefully acknowledges our 2025/26 season sponsor:
The Thomas Alan Budd Foundation.

World Premiere

New Work by Alexis Fletcher and Sylvain Senez

Choreography: Alexis Fletcher and Sylvain Senez
Vancouver-based Belle Spirale Dance Projects' Artistic Directors Alexis Fletcher and Sylvain Senez bring their celebrated artistry to Kelowna for the first time in a stunning new work that explores the fleeting nature of time. Their raw and emotionally-driven movement will bring to life the urgent desire to grasp hold of the present as they explore the paradoxical pull of past and future. This gripping world premiere features an original composition by Ben Waters.

Doppeling

Choreography: Simone Orlando
Originally created for Ballet BC in 2009 and later remounted by both Ballet BC and Ballet Kelowna, Simone Orlando’s Doppeling has been described by The Georgia Straight as “a gender-bending vision of doppelganger ballerinas breaking loose.” Set to J.S. Bach’s Double Violin Concerto, the piece features the ensemble clad in identical shimmering gold unitards and sleek bobbed wigs. A mesmerizing commentary on conformity and individuality, Doppeling is at once playful, serene, and stylishly subversive.

The Cowboy Act Suite

Choreography: Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe
After its successful 2023 debut, Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe’s The Cowboy Act was reimagined for the road as The Cowboy Act Suite, with refreshed scenes and new surprises for touring audiences. Set to music by Tom Wilson and iskwē, the work includes a life-sized chuckwagon blasting across the stage. A sharp and satirical take on the “Cowboys and Indians” trope, this production reclaims the narrative by putting the Indigenous voice in the director’s chair – challenging whose story gets told, and by whom.

Subscriptions on sale until November 8, 2025.

Ballet Kelowna tickets and their applicable fees are non-refundable.

htmlDescription:
Ballet Kelowna presents

RESTLESS BALANCE

November 7 + 8, 2025

Friday at 7:30 PM / Saturday at 1:30 PM and 7:30 PM


Ballet Kelowna gratefully acknowledges our 2025/26 season sponsor:
The Thomas Alan Budd Foundation.

World Premiere

New Work by Andrew Skeels

Choreography: Andrew Skeels
Montréal-based choreographer Andrew Skeels brings his ever-expanding curiosity and love for the art of dance to a brand-new work for Ballet Kelowna. Drawing influence from his training as a film editor, Skeels applies a cinematic approach to his choreography, challenging the dancers to move with daring speed, breathtaking fluidity, and bold release.

taqəš

Choreography: Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe
Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe brings his classical ballet training, knowledge of traditional Coast Salish, grass, and hoop dance, and experience as a contemporary dancer to taqəš [tawKESH], which means “to return something” in Ayajuthem, the language belonging to the Homalco, Klahoose, K’omoks, and Tla’amin Nations. Set to several songs by Polaris Prize-winning composer and singer Jeremy Dutcher, taqəš follows the traditional story “Raven Returns the Water,” centred around ῤoho (raven) and walθ (frog).

Schubert

Choreography: John Alleyne
Commissioned by Ballet BC in 2000 as a tribute to Canadian ballerina Jean Orr, John Alleyne’s Schubert celebrates the life of a dancer in three poetic scenes: youth, beauty, and wisdom. Set to Franz Schubert’s luminous Piano Trio No. 2 in E-flat Major, the work embodies what The Georgia Straight calls an “inherent... sensuousness and sophistication,” while capturing a sense of ethereal transience. This neoclassical piece honours the rhythmic and inevitable cycle of life with grace, depth, and emotional resonance.

Subscriptions on sale until November 8, 2025.

Ballet Kelowna tickets and their applicable fees are non-refundable.

htmlDescription:
Ballet Kelowna presents

RESTLESS BALANCE

November 7 + 8, 2025

Friday at 7:30 PM / Saturday at 1:30 PM and 7:30 PM


Ballet Kelowna gratefully acknowledges our 2025/26 season sponsor:
The Thomas Alan Budd Foundation.

World Premiere

New Work by Andrew Skeels

Choreography: Andrew Skeels
Montréal-based choreographer Andrew Skeels brings his ever-expanding curiosity and love for the art of dance to a brand-new work for Ballet Kelowna. Drawing influence from his training as a film editor, Skeels applies a cinematic approach to his choreography, challenging the dancers to move with daring speed, breathtaking fluidity, and bold release.

taqəš

Choreography: Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe
Cameron sinkʷə Fraser-Monroe brings his classical ballet training, knowledge of traditional Coast Salish, grass, and hoop dance, and experience as a contemporary dancer to taqəš [tawKESH], which means “to return something” in Ayajuthem, the language belonging to the Homalco, Klahoose, K’omoks, and Tla’amin Nations. Set to several songs by Polaris Prize-winning composer and singer Jeremy Dutcher, taqəš follows the traditional story “Raven Returns the Water,” centred around ῤoho (raven) and walθ (frog).

Schubert

Choreography: John Alleyne
Commissioned by Ballet BC in 2000 as a tribute to Canadian ballerina Jean Orr, John Alleyne’s Schubert celebrates the life of a dancer in three poetic scenes: youth, beauty, and wisdom. Set to Franz Schubert’s luminous Piano Trio No. 2 in E-flat Major, the work embodies what The Georgia Straight calls an “inherent... sensuousness and sophistication,” while capturing a sense of ethereal transience. This neoclassical piece honours the rhythmic and inevitable cycle of life with grace, depth, and emotional resonance.

Subscriptions on sale until November 8, 2025.

Ballet Kelowna tickets and their applicable fees are non-refundable.

htmlDescription:
In partnership with Creative Okanagan

BLACK DOG

The Spirit of Led Zeppelin


Montreal's celebrated Led Zeppelin tribute act “Black Dog” is coming to the West Coast for the first time — tickets for their 2026 shows are on sale now!

“Black Dog—The Spirit of Led Zeppelin” captures Led Zep's early years in a show that brings to life the essence of Led Zeppelin. From the first crushing riff of “Whole Lotta Love” to the final echos of “Kashmir” and “Stairway to Heaven”, Black Dog delivers an authentic experience with the chemistry and respect the music deserves: raw, electric, and alive. “If Zeppelin defines the soundtrack of your youth, this is your chance to feel it all again” explains bassist Frank Larouche. “Close your eyes, you will swear you’re back in 1973”.

With over 250 concerts to their credit and an unwavering commitment to authenticity, this powerhouse quartet channels the raw energy, soaring vocals, and legendary musicianship that made Led Zeppelin unforgettable.

It’s Whose Line is it Anyway meets The Thunder from Down Under!

The cast of Canadian Steam has rocked stages at Just for Laughs, picked up Canadian Comedy Awards, and performed with Second City - appearing on CBC’s The Debaters, Netflix, and Amazon Prime. Now they’re bringing you a comedy show that’s 100% Canadian and 1000% ridiculous.

* Exciting crowd work!

Click Here to Watch them in Action!

From the creators at The Comedy Department - winners of the 2025 TripAdvisor Travellers’ Choice Award, this laugh-out-loud sexy spectacle has been delighting audiences everywhere.

These flannel-clad heartthrobs have been officially dispatched by the Ministry of Sexy™ (yes, that’s totally a thing) to prove that Canada isn’t just nice - it’s devastatingly funny. If not? They'll be politely asked to hang up their plaid and retreat quietly to their log cabins in shame. Armed with maple syrup, silky serenades, some of the most averagely sexy bods this side of the Rockies, these lumberjacks are on a government-sanctioned mission to bring the funny and the heat - one Timbit-loving town at a time.

So whether you're out with your crew, celebrating something big, or just craving a night of maple-drenched mayhem - Canadian Steam is the comedy experience you didn’t even know was included in your healthcare.

Step into a winter wonderland of melody as award-winning vocalist Anna Jacyszyn returns to the Rotary Centre for the Arts with "Christmas Presence!," her signature holiday concert. This beloved annual tradition, which has warmed hearts since 2015, blends original seasonal compositions with jazz-infused Christmas classics.

Experience the magic of Anna's original holiday hits including "Snow Day," "Cashmere and Love," and her latest single "Clink Cheer!" – all wrapped in the warm embrace of jazz, blues, and soul. Backed by an all-star ensemble featuring Stu Goldberg (piano), Scott Gamble (drums), Stefan Bienz (double bass), and Stephen Buck (woodwinds), this evening promises to sparkle like freshly fallen snow.

Join in the festive spirit with audience sing-alongs of seasonal favorites, guaranteed to carry the joy of the season all the way home. Proclaimed "a phenomenon" by the Los Angeles Times and "one of the best pianists of his generation" by the Philadelphia Inquirer, Canadian Stewart Goodyear is an accomplished concert pianist, improviser and composer. He has performed with, and has been commissioned by, many of the major orchestras and chamber music organizations around the world.

His extensive discography includes Beethoven’s Complete Piano Sonatas, two of which he will include in this program. As well, he has recorded concertos by Tchaikovsky, Grieg and Rachmaninov, an album of Ravel piano works, and an album, entitled "For Glenn Gould", which combines repertoire from Mr. Gould's US and Montreal debuts. Stewart’s Rachmaninov recording received a Juno nomination for Best Classical Album for Soloist and Large Ensemble Accompaniment. His recording of his own transcription of Tchaikovsky's "The Nutcracker (Complete Ballet)", was chosen by the New York Times as one of the best classical music recordings of 2015.

description: Completely Creedence Band is a high-energy tribute to CCR, delivering authentic performances of classic hits like “Proud Mary” and “Fortunate Son.” Led by Jamie Robertson, whose voice echoes John Fogerty’s, this talented Canadian group captures CCR’s spirit, thrilling audiences at festivals, theatres, and events across the country.
htmlDescription:
JDR Enterprises presents

COMPLETELY CREEDENCE

A Tribute to CCR


COMPLETELY CREEDENCE BAND is a dynamic tribute to the iconic American rock band CCR (Creedence Clearwater Revival). This talented group of musicians brings the classic hits and energy of CCR to audiences across the country. With a deep appreciation for the music and a commitment to delivering an authentic performance, Completely Creedence Band captures the essence of CCR's sound and spirit.

Led by a frontman with a powerful voice and a commanding stage presence, Completely Creedence Band delivers high-energy performances that leave audiences singing along and dancing in the aisles. From "Proud Mary" and "Bad Moon Rising" to "Fortunate Son" and "Have You Ever Seen the Rain", they faithfully recreate CCR's greatest hits.
With years of experience and a passion for the music, Completely Creedence Band has become one of the most sought-after tribute acts in Canada. Whether performing at Theatres, festivals, corporate events, or private parties, they always bring the same level of energy and excitement to the stage. For fans of classic rock and CCR, Completely Creedence Band is a must-see act that never fails to deliver an unforgettable performance.

The Band features:
Jamie Robertson vocals and rhythm guitar
Murray Atkinson on guitar and backing vocals
Lance Lapointe on bass guitar and backing vocals
Grant Baird on drums and backing vocals

Audiences have marveled about how remarkably similar Robertson’s voice sounds to John Fogerty’s, capturing all the subtle nuances of his vocals. Completely Creedence Band delivers a musical experience where your love of CCR will live on through these four incredible musicians who share your passion of CCR’s music

htmlDescription:
Kootenay Concert Connection presents

DALLAS SMITH + HIS BAND

One Night Only Unplugged

Featuring Brock Phillips


ABOUT DALLAS SMITH

Big Loud artist Dallas Smith has a track record of noteworthy success - from front man of Platinum-selling rock band Default to 3x consecutive CCMA Entertainer of the Year. Across his storied career, the bona fide hitmaker has amassed 21 Gold-certified singles, nine Platinum-certified singles, and four Gold-certified albums, with more than 640 million global streams and over two million album equivalents to date. Adding yet another milestone, Smith made his Grand Ole Opry debut last summer. Smith’s first full-length project with Big Loud Records, self-titled album Dallas Smith, was produced by longtime collaborator Joey Moi and features writing credits from HARDY, Cole Swindell, GRAMMY-nominated songwriter Ashley Gorley and ERNEST, and GRAMMY-winning songwriter Hillary Lindsey.

htmlDescription:
Train Wreck Comedy presents

DINO ARCHIE'S K-TOWN COMEDY EXTRAVAGANZA


Kelowna, prepare yourselves for a comedy event of epic proportions. Train Wreck Comedy is bringing a must-see night of unstoppable laughter to the Mary Irwin Theatre—and leading the charge is one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today: Dino Archie.

A Netflix is a Joke Fest headliner, Jimmy Kimmel Live guest, and winner of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Dino Archie is a force of nature on stage. Known for his fearless crowd work, sharp storytelling, and authentic style, Dino’s latest special "Toxic But Safe" is racking up views and praise on YouTube—and now it’s Kelowna’s turn to experience the real thing.

Sharing the stage with Dino is a stellar lineup of comedy heavyweights:

Chris Robinson – One of the hottest comics in the country, Chris is the winner of SiriusXM’s Top Comic competition and a standout at Just For Laughs. With a Crave special (Panning for Gold), scene-stealing roles in Pillow Talk, Roast Battle Canada, and a presence that owns any room, Chris brings both firepower and finesse to the mic.

Yumi Nagashima – A Tokyo-born comedic powerhouse with viral fame and international acclaim. Whether it’s Just For Laughs, Comedy Central Asia, or CBC’s New Wave of Stand-Up, Yumi’s unique voice and magnetic stage presence continue to win hearts and laughter worldwide.

Andrew Crone – Named the Okanagan’s “hardest act to follow,” Crone is a sharp, fearless comic whose biting wit hits with precision. He’s a festival favourite (JFL Northwest, Grindstone, Okanagan Comedy Festival) and a SiriusXM regular.

🔥 This isn’t just a comedy show. It’s a K-Town Comedy Extravaganza. One night. Four killer acts. Unlimited laughs. Don’t wait.

htmlDescription:
Mur-Man Productions presents

EAGLE EYES

"THE" Tribute to The Eagles



"Eagles dominated soft rock throughout the 70’s with unforgettable hits like Take It Easy, Witchy Woman, Best Of My Love, One of These Nights, Lyin’ Eyes, Take It To The Limit, New Kid In Town. Hotel California, Life In The Fast Lane, Heartache Tonight, The Long Run, I Can’t Tell You Why… and more.

Beautiful and catchy melodies with amazing lead and harmony vocals have made the Eagles one of the most famous, respected and loved rock groups of all time, with broad appeal to all ages. Eagle Eyes capture lead and harmony vocals with breath-taking precision that is nothing less than stunning. All vocals are live…. you won’t hear a single pre-recorded vocal track and no auto-tune.

Eagle Eyes is the best Eagles tribute in North America, and has received standing ovations from audiences in Canada, and in several States in the USA, including Washington, Oregon, California, Arizona, Idaho and Alaska Eagle Eyes are… Jack Gunderson, bass and lead vocals, fills the vocal roles of Glenn Frey and Timothy B. Schmidt. Jason Dunajski, guitars and lead vocals, fills the vocal roles of Don Henley and Randy Meisner. Ray Harvey, guitars and lead vocals, fills the vocal role of Joe Walsh. Kenneth Ermter, drums and lead vocals, also fills the vocal roles of Henley and Meisner.

All four members of Eagle Eyes are lifetime professional musicians with several decades of combined experience on the road and in the studio with a number of different bands and projects over the years. Eagle Eyes embrace all of this musical dedication and experience to deliver a show that is nothing short of magnificent, making them among the top-drawing tribute acts wherever they perform."

Pricing

htmlDescription:
Creative Okanagan presents

EDGE OF THE RANGE SHOWCASE

Creative Okanagan Members Access Page


Featuring local musicians and Creative Okanagan members:
Kris Anders Band
Shalisa
Jese Lawrence

And:
Elli Hart (Victoria)

with special guests!

In partnership with:
Kelowna Museums and their Ranches and Rodeos exhibit - running to October 13
the Canadian Country Music Association and the Country Crawl

Two step lesson at 7:15 pm!

Funding from: City of Kelowna, Creative BC
Partners: Kelowna Museums, CCMA Country Crawl

Artist bios:

Kris Anders Band (Vernon)
An award-winning Canadian singer-songwriter with roots in both rock and country, Kris Anders is known for his poetic lyrics, strong melodies, and powerful storytelling. From small-town Manitoba to major music award nominations, Kris has garnered international attention with tracks like Shattered and Ever Enough. With over a million streams and accolades from the Josie Music Awards in Nashville and the Western Canadian Music Awards, Kris delivers a show that’s both emotionally resonant and sonically polished. Kris performs both as a solo act and with his backing band, The Flatlanders.
https://krisanders.com

Elli Hart (Victoria)
Elli Hart is a Dark Country artist with a crossover edge—blending the grit of outlaw country, the soul of blues, and the weight of rock. Her haunting, heavy songs are built on searing vocals, raw guitar, and stories pulled straight from real life. On stage, she moves between vulnerable confession and fierce release, delivering a show that hits hard and stays with you.
https://ellihart.com

Jese Lawrence (Kelowna)
Jese Lawrence is an emerging country artist whose music blends the grit of southern rock with the heart of Americana. Drawing inspiration from Tyler Childers and Zach Bryan, his songs are raw, honest, and built to stick with you long after the last chord. In this intimate solo set, Jese brings the stories behind his songs to life, mixing foot-stomping energy with moments that’ll stop you in your tracks. Expect heartfelt storytelling, driving rhythms, and a voice that feels like it’s been lived in — the perfect backdrop for his latest releases and unreleased tunes!
https://jeselawrencemusic.com

Shalisa (Kelowna)
Country Girl Gone Rogue! Shalisa is a bold and authentic pop-country artist whose music empowers and connects through raw, relatable storytelling. With a sound that blends soul, rock, and country, she crafts songs that celebrate life’s highs, navigate its lows, and inspire self-belief. Her biggest single, Bad Hangover, has grown her audience from hundreds to thousands, earning praise for its vulnerability and strength.
https://shalisalieschmusic.wixsite.com/shalisa

Pricing

By Donation
name: Edge of the Range Showcase - Members Only Event

Moon Coin Productions Inc. presents

ELECTRIC ELTON

A Tribute to Elton John


Attention Elton John fans! Moon Coin Productions (Producers of ABBA Tribute “ABRA Cadabra” and Eagles Tribute “Take It To The Limit”) Presents Electric Elton – A Tribute to Elton John from Vancouver is coming on March 23, 2026 to Kelowna for the 1st time!

Don't miss this visually and musically captivating stage production led by accomplished vocalist, pianist and star performer Sean Trombley, who gives a genuine & powerful tribute to the music that inspired him as a vocalist and musician. Sean’s stunning vocals capture the essence of Elton John at the height of his vocal power and range in the 1970’s and he brings these beautiful songs to life in a way that touches the soul and uplifts the heart.

Backed by a spectacular live band, multi-media, dazzling costumes and captivating dancers, this high-energy cast of performers will transport you back in time and have you moving, smiling and singing along to all of Elton John’s most iconic hits including Rocket Man, Crocodile Rock, Benny & The Jets, Tiny Dancer, Your Song, Saturday Night’s Alright, Philadelphia Freedom, Good-bye Yellow Brick Road, Daniel, Candle in the Wind and countless others! A must see show if you love the music of Elton John!

Follow the show’s journey on Facebook and Instagram @TributeToEltonJohn

Visit the official website for more information: ILoveEltonJohn.com

Secure your tickets now and get ready to relive the unforgettable hits and iconic style of Elton John in this spectacular tribute performance!

For one night, you get to experience what it would’ve been like to witness The King of Rock ‘n’ Roll live in the flesh. htmlDescription:
Combined Forces Production Collaborative presents

FALLEN HEROES:

THEIR JOURNEY HOME


Fallen Heroes is a powerful documentary about the Canadian Armed Forces in Afghanistan. This film touches upon some key battles, highlights the war’s impact on Canadians, and is a tribute to the courage and bravery of our men and women in uniform.

More than 40,000 Canadian Armed Forces members served in Afghanistan over the 14-year campaign. Very few Canadians understand why we were in Afghanistan and why it was important yet it was the most significant operation for the Canadian Armed Forces in two generations. Canada lost 159 soldiers and 4 civilians in Afghanistan. Three times that number came home with physical wounds and countless more with moral and stress injuries. Over 200 Canadian soldiers have committed suicide since their return home from the war.

PG-13 Trigger Warning; some of the events shown may trigger traumatic memories.

GEORDIE KIEFFER

Hush Hush Canada Tour

with special guest Lilyisthatyou


Geordie Kieffer, the sultry trailblazer of Agro Pop, has set the music scene ablaze with his intoxicating mix of hip hop, pop, and electronic vibes. His debut album and steamy music videos, featuring pulse-pounding tracks like “Sex Party,” “Icon Killer,” and “Swinger,” left fans breathless and begging for more. But it was the irresistible viral banger “Red Line” that sent Geordie’s star soaring, racking up over 100K TikTok and IG reel sound uses and a jaw-dropping 75M+ global streams—talk about a track that gets everyone in the mood! His eclectic lyrics and hooks so catchy they’re practically a flirtatious wink have seduced a devoted following that can’t get enough.

 In 2024, Geordie’s independently promoted 25-city tour sold out faster than you can say “encore,” drawing fans of all ages to witness his electrifying live show—a performance so hot, you’ll need a cold shower afterward. His stage energy? Pure, unadulterated spark that leaves audiences hot and bothered, craving their next Geordie fix. With seductive new singles like Hush Hush teasing their way to release, Geordie’s 2025 tour promises to be bigger, sexier, and the steamiest party of the year. Get ready to lose yourself in the rhythm—and maybe steal a glance at Geordie’s mischievous grin while you’re at it.

htmlDescription:
Murray & Peter present

GOLDEN GIRLS

The Laughs Continue


Age restriction: 18+ only (adult theme comedy)

The Golden Girls are back in an all-new show! 2025 finds Sophia out on bail, after being busted by the DEA for running a drug ring at Shady Pines. Blanche and Rose have founded CreakN, a thriving sex app for seniors. And Dorothy is trying to hold it all together, with help from her much younger, sex-crazed love interest. Relive the heartfelt hilarity of four ladies who never stopped being your friends! There will be a 20-minute intermission. Presented by Murray & Peter. Get tour info at GoldenGirlsTour.com.

Golden Girls Tour Video

Fans Are Raving About Golden Girls: The Laughs Continue!

htmlDescription:
VaughnCo Entertainment Inc. presents

HIGHWAYMEN

Great Outlaws Tribute Show


In 1984, Johnny Cash invited Willie Nelson, Waylon Jennings and Kris Kristofferson to play on his Johnny Cash Christmas TV Special that was filmed in Switzerland. When they got back to the hotel, they started jamming and hanging out and that was how the Highwaymen came to be.

The Highwaymen Show pays tribute to the great American Outlaws of Country Music - Johnny Cash, Willie Nelson, Waylon Jennings and Kris Kristofferson. The Show covers all of the greatest hits including “Mama Don't Let Your Babies Grow up to be Cowboys”, “Always on My Mind”, “Me and Bobby McGee” and “Folsom Prison Blues”
Don’t miss this trip down memory lane with the look and sound of these iconic superstars: The entire show will feel like an encore!

Pricing

Regular $63.26 ($52.50 base price + $2.36 CIF + $8.40 service charge)


All above prices are in CAD and include GST.

htmlDescription:
Punchline Nutrition presents

ALEX MACKENZIE'S HUNGRY FOR LAUGHS COMEDY TOUR

Get ready to laugh for a cause!

Canada’s Funnest Comedy Tour is rolling into town, and it's more than just a night of stand-up comedy!

Founded by comedian Alex Mackenzie and proudly produced by Canadian-owned ECL Productions, the Hungry for Laughs Comedy Tour brings together the best comedians in the country for an unforgettable night of laughter, love, and giving back. Each show supports a local charity, so when you buy a ticket, you're not just treating yourself to world-class comedy - you're helping your community thrive.

Whether you’ve seen us on Amazon Prime, Just for Laughs, CBC’s The Debaters, and many more you’re in for a night of Gut Busting Laughter inside some of the most beautiful venues in the country!

Hundreds of hours go into producing each show - all to create a moment. And when you're in that moment, laughing alongside hundreds of people from your community, you're making memories with your loved ones that will last long after the curtain closes.

If you love stand-up comedy, believe in giving back to your community, and enjoy supporting the rising comedic stars of Canada - this show was made for you.

Come laugh loud, give back, and feel good doing it.
Stand up to hunger. It’s no laughing matter.

Comedians:

Alex Mackenzie - (Amazon Prime, Melbourne Comedy Festival)

Chris Griffin - (Just for Laughs, Voted Vancouvers Funniest Comedian)

Brittany Lyseng - (CBC Debaters, Just for Laughs, Roast Battle Canada)

Sunee Dhaliwal - (Just for Laughs, Comedy Network, Opened for Bill Burr)

Senior: $49.95 ($40.50 + $2.10 CIF + $7.35 service charge)
Student w/ID: $49.95 ($40.50 + $2.10 CIF + $7.35 service charge)

All above prices are in CAD and include GST.

htmlDescription:
Kelowna Actors Studio presents

JOSEPH

and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat


Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber’s multi award-winning show, Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat, has become one of the world’s most beloved family musicals. It has been performed hundreds of thousands of times, including multiple runs in the West End and on Broadway, as well as international tours in over 80 countries worldwide.

Joseph reimagines the story of Joseph, his father Jacob, eleven brothers, and the coat of many colors. Featuring a variety of catchy songs, from the parody of French ballads in “Those Canaan Days,” to the country-western style of “One More Angel in Heaven,” and the calypso rhythm of “Benjamin Calypso.” It also includes unforgettable classics like “Any Dream Will Do” and “Close Every Door.”

Suitable for all audiences, Joseph is a vibrant celebration of resilience and self-discovery, proving that with faith, courage, and a little bit of technicolor, dreams really can come true.

Pricing

Regular: $84.00 ($72.45 + $2.10 CIF + $9.45 Service Fee)

All above prices are in CAD and include GST.

---

description: Join us for an unforgettable afternoon of rhythm, energy, and culture as we welcome Ryo Shimamoto, a world-class taiko drummer all the way from Japan.  He will be joined on stage by fellow performer Itsuka Shioji, adding even more artistry and energy to the performance.
htmlDescription:
Yamabiko Taiko presents

KIZUNA CONNECTION

ft. Ryo Shimamoto & Itsuka Shioji


Experience the Power of Taiko – Featuring Ryo Shimamoto from Japan

Join us for an unforgettable afternoon of rhythm, energy, and culture as we welcome Ryo Shimamoto, a world-class taiko drummer all the way from Japan. He will be joined on stage by fellow performer Itsuka Shioji, adding even more artistry and energy to the performance.

Opening the show will be Kelowna's very own Yamabiko Taiko, bringing the vibrant spirit of our local community to the stage. This special performance will feature a powerful blend of traditional Japanese taiko drumming and dynamic contemporary arrangements, showcasing both the artistry and the athleticism of this centuries-old musical form.

Feel the thunder of the drums, the precision of the beats, and the passion of the performers as they bring the spirit of Japan to our stage.

Pricing

Adult $35.00 ($28.60 base price + $2.10 CIF + $4.30 service charge)
Child under 12 $25.00 ($19.91 base price + $2.10 CIF + $2.99 service charge)

All above prices are in CAD and include GST.

---

Mary Irwin Theatre at the Rotary Centre for the Arts event tickets include a $2.10 Capital Improvement Fee (CIF). A service fee is added for box office costs, card processing, and taxes. Kizuna Connection tickets and their applicable fees are non-refundable.
name: Kizuna Connection

description:
Ballet Kelowna’s LAUNCH returns to the Rotary Centre for the Arts for the first time since 2021. Join us for this one-hour, informal showing and get a sneak peek at what’s in store for Ballet Kelowna’s 2025/26 season. Meet our company of dance artists and learn about upcoming performances at the RCA.
 
LAUNCH is free or by donation.

htmlDescription:
The Gary Cable Foundation presents

LEGENDARY ROCK LIVE!


featuring The Gary Cable Project


Back by popular demand! The Gary Cable Project makes its return to the Kelowna Community Theatre with Legendary Rock Live! The 'Project returns to the Okanagan with its world-class horn section, to perform some of the greatest music ever made -- Chicago, Blood Sweat & Tears, Steely Dan, Supertramp, Tina Turner, Toto, Lighthouse, Three Dog Night -- and more! Don't miss this unforgettable night of "Legendary Music by Legendary Musicians"!

Comprised of Canada’s top live and session players, The Gary Cable Project is a 9-piece band including full horn section; an All-Star group of musicians who have recorded and performed and toured with the legends — Barbra Streisand, Bryan Adams, Aerosmith, Chilliwack, the Pointer Sisters, Sarah McLachlan, David Foster, the Powder Blues, Stuart Copeland (the Police), David Clayton-Thomas/Blood Sweat and Tears, Long John Baldry, Jann Arden, Colin James, Gino Vanelli, Michael Bublé — to name a few. You do not want to miss the Tour!

All proceeds benefit The Central Okanagan Foundation.

For more information: www.garycableproject.com

A Musical Salute to the Beach Boys


Hello Beach Boy fans and live music lovers,


We are very sorry to have to cancel and reschedule our May 30th "Let's Go Surfin'! - Beach Boys Tribute" show at the Mary Irwin Theater in the Rotary Centre for the Arts. htmlDescription:
Live Nation presents

MATT ANDERSEN: THE HAMMER & THE ROSE TOUR


When Matt Andersen steps on stage, he brings a lifetime of music to every note he plays. His latest album, The Hammer & The Rose, is a veritable garden of heart; a (mostly) delicate collection of tender folk and stirring soul numbers that find the New Brunswick-born songwriter thoughtfully tending to the most important things in life. Andersen’s stage presence is informed by decades of cutting his teeth in dusty clubs, dim-lit bars, and grand theatres all over the world, delivering moving performances that run the gamut from intimate to wall-shaking. In the studio, he’s always brought the same attention to detail and commitment to craft as he has to his live show, and the result - a multi-faceted and poignant body of work - has led him to amass over 33 million streams on Spotify and 30 million views on YouTube.

In addition to headlining major festivals, clubs and theatres throughout North America, Europe, and Australia, he has shared the stage and toured with Marcus King, Beth Hart, Marty Stuart, Greg Allman, Tedeschi Trucks Band, Randy Bachman, Serena Ryder, Tab Benoit, and more.

Andersen nabbed the 2013 and 2016 European Blues Awards for Best Solo/Acoustic Act, was the first ever Canadian to take home top honours in the solo category at the 2010 International Blues Challenge in Memphis, won the CIMA Road Gold award in 2015, and has won multiple Maple Blues Awards. Matt Andersen & The Big Bottle of Joy was nominated for a Juno Award in 2024.

description: Michael Turner is a piano prodigy with a unique and powerful vocal style who will be bringing his energy filled, dynamic performance style to The Rotary Atrium! Playing a mix of originals and covers, each song will be its own story, weaving together his life story through music.
htmlDescription:
Michael Turner presents

MICHAEL TURNER LIVE AT THE ROTARY

Michael Turner is a piano prodigy with a unique and powerful vocal style who will be bringing his energy filled, dynamic performance style to The Rotary Atrium on November 15th! Playing a mix of originals and covers, each song will be it’s own story, weaving together his life story through music.

After cutting his teeth on the stylings of Elton John, Paul McCartney, Billy Joel and Floyd Cramer, Michael ventured into the world of composition, starting up the moderately successful funk-rock band Ripple Illusion.

Since then he’s only added to his repertoire between playing copious venues including everything from retirement homes to pubs, breweries and everything in between. Recently this has culminated in a new project of donning a wig, sparkles and tributing his hero, the great Sir Elton John.

No matter what the project, Michael sounds his absolute best where he will be playing for you - on a grand piano. His piano style will captivate and command and take you with it. His vocal style will surprise you and make you feel emotions you weren’t expecting. And his song selection, whether it be classics, deep cuts or originals, will lead you into dying to know what’s coming next.

Please join us for this special evening!

htmlDescription:
Kootenay Concert Connection presents

MOONDANCE

The Van Morrison Songbook


Notice from the promoter:
Due to unforeseen circumstances, this show has been cancelled in Kelowna. We sincerely regret any inconvenience this may cause and thank you for your understanding.
We appreciate your support and hope to see you at future events.



Experience Moondance: The Van Morrison Songbook, performing all the iconic hits including “Gloria,” “Brown Eyed Girl,” “Moondance,” “Into the Mystic,” “Domino,” “Wild Night is Calling” and more. Performed with soulful conviction and joy, vocalist Bruce Coughlan (Tiller’s Folly), winner of the 2024 ISSA Top Male Vocalist award, fronts this six-piece revue. Joined by longtime collaborator Laurence Knight (bass/vocals), and a top-tier ensemble including Adam Rohrlick (guitar/keys), Jerry Cook (sax/flute), Geeta Das (trumpet), and Greg Stuart (drums/vocals) - they bring Van’s Celtic-inspired blend of blues, jazz, folk, and soul to life. This show will have you singing along and shutting your eyes to truly make you think that the legendary Hall of Famer Van Morrison is in the room with you. Be prepared to be totally entertained as “Van the Man” and stellar all-star cast bring with them the utmost respect, energy, and joy to this great icon's career to life!

Bruce Coughlan channels “Van the Man,” a mystic Celtic soul singer whose career spans over five decades, from his early days with Them in the ‘60s to his groundbreaking ‘70s albums like Moondance, and Van Morrison His Band, and the Street Choir. With classics like “And It Stoned Me,” “Crazy Love,” and “Caravan,” Morrison’s distinctive sound remains a staple of classic rock and blues. This show, fueled by Coughlan’s award-winning interpretive skill and the band’s dynamic energy, promises a night of unforgettable music. Moondance - the Van Morrison Songbook Experience is a presentation of the Kootenay Concert Connection.
name: Moondance - Cancelled

description: “Don’t mix business with pleasure,” they say—but comedians Natalie Cuomo and Dan LaMorte prove otherwise. After meeting at a New York comedy club, they fell in love, got engaged, and now tour together. Their show features solo sets followed by a crowd-favorite duo performance full of chemistry and laughs.
htmlDescription:
MODO-LIVE Arts & Entertainment presents

NATALIE CUOMO & DAN LAMORTE


Do not mix business with pleasure, that’s what they say.

Stand -up comedians, Natalie Cuomo and Dan LaMorte, disagree. After meeting while both performing at a comedy club in New York City, in an industry that lacks an HR department, the two started dating, added some tattoos, quickly got engaged, and the rest is history. For the last few years, this duo has been touring the country, and world, with their unique show. Audiences first get to enjoy individual sets by Dan and Natalie, but then each show closes with the usual fan-favorite combo set. The couple comes on stage together, playing off each other and the crowd, in a way only two people who spend almost every single day together can.

htmlDescription:
James & Jamesy present

O CHRISTMAS TEA

A British Comedy


Fans of Monty Python, Mr. Bean, and Dr. Seuss… Grab your teacups!


Combining British propriety with an unabashed love for the unexpected, London’s 3-time Impresario Award-winning duo steep an outrageously funny and brilliantly inventive show reminiscent of classic British pantos.

Rich in wordplay, comic physicality, and cleverly crafted interactive elements, O Christmas Tea is uproarious fun, yet it is the duo’s boundless imagination and endearing chemistry that provide the real magic and heart of this play.

When catastrophe strikes at James and Jamesy’s Christmas tea party, flooding the world with tea, the duo conjure wildly funny solutions to stay afloat, and sweep the audience out to sea in a jolly aquatic escapade brimming with whimsy, action, and ingenuity in a celebration of friendship at Christmas.

“Complete and utter fun… for all ages.”
★★★★★ CBC

“Outrageously funny, magnificently written, beautifully choreographed.”
★★★★★ London Free Press

“An ode to the idea that anything is possible.”
★★★★★ Torontoist

“I cannot think of a show that will leave you more profoundly happy than this.”
★★★★★ Stage Door

Hailed as “a child’s imagination on steroids” by London Free Press and “a masterpiece of physical comedy” by Theatre In London, critics rave for the charismatic James & Jamesy. A must-see performance on the international comedy circuit, this unstoppable duo is regarded as “one of the most popular fringe duos ever” (CBC).

 For a glimpse into the world of O Christmas Tea, click here!

description: Objects in Motion is an annual selection of international short animated films curated by local animator Myron Campbell. These films push the boundaries of storytelling and animation through innovative formal exploration. Objects in Motion is emotionally impactful, taking us to places we really didn’t think it was possible to go….
htmlDescription:
Inner Fish Theatre Society presents

OBJECTS IN MOTION ENCORE!

and First Look at Living Things 2026


This event is for mature audiences.

Objects in Motion, a Living Things Festival favorite since 2017, is an annual selection of international short animated films curated by local artist, professor, and animator Myron Campbell. These films push the boundaries of storytelling and animation through innovative formal exploration. Whether showcasing hand-drawn works, stop-motion with physical objects, or digitally created puppetry, Objects in Motion is always a diverse, unexpected and emotionally impactful selection — from hilarity to pointed social critique — taking us to places we really didn’t think it was possible to go….

Why “Encore”? This special screening revisits the January 2025 edition of Objects in Motion. We loved it and heard great reviews from festival audiences, so we're bringing it back. We’ve added another film—a surprise for returning viewers and an added delight for everyone. Don’t miss this chance to experience these unique films in a comfortable chair with great acoustics, cinema quality visuals, and the best company in town.

Before the screening begins, we will give you a first look at the Living Things 2026 Festival lineup—our 10th anniversary edition! Be the first to discover the incredible performances coming to Kelowna in January.

We’d love to meet you, join us for a drink in the upstairs lobby at 6:30pm, the screening starts at 7:00pm.

Okanagan Symphony Orchestra presents

ANNA & WOLFGANG

featuring Martin Krátký, cello


Two master composers separated by 200 years, and a performance bursting with musical contrasts. Maria Fuller makes her OSO conducting debut in works by Mozart and Anna Clyne, one of the most in-demand living composers. The OSO's Martin Krátký is soloist in the soulfully melodic concerto DANCE; we conclude with Mozart’s most famous symphony.

htmlDescription:
Okanagan Symphony Orchestra presents

BEETHOVEN'S FIFTH

featuring the OSO Chorus


Experience the symphony that changed music forever. Shocking at the time of its premiere with its emotional intensity, today Beethoven’s Fifth is one of the world’s most recognizable works of art. After more than a decade, the OSO returns to this iconic masterpiece to close the season with this monument of musical expression. This concert also features the OSO Chorus in Ola Gjeilo’s Sunrise Mass, a profound and expressive journey, full of soaring melodies and walls of sonic power.

ART & AI DISCUSSION PANEL


POSTPONED TO A LATER DATE (TBD)


Registration is currently inactive until a new date has been scheduled. Please add your name to the waitlist to be contacted when registration re-opens.

Exploring the Intersection of Creativity and Algorithms


Join us for an engaging moderated panel exploring how artificial intelligence is shaping the arts and cultural sector. This session brings together diverse industry leader such as a visual artist, a performing arts director, a technology entrepreneur, and an arts policy maker—to discuss the opportunities and challenges of integrating AI into creative practices. Topics will include AI-driven innovation in artistic expression, marketing pros and cons, ethical considerations, audience engagement, and the evolving role of human creativity. The new RCA Panel Discussion Series serves as a dynamic forum for exploring contemporary issues in arts and culture. By bringing together thought leaders, practitioners, and community members, the series fosters civil discourse, collaboration, and innovation, inspiring deeper engagement within the cultural sector.

Art & AI Panel

description: Born from a dream, funded by commercial fishing in Alaska, and driven by a love for life on the edge, "Pressure Drop" follows the world’s best skiers and snowboarders through massive cliffs and deep powder, from Norway to home in Wyoming. This film captures that split-second when fear meets flow.
htmlDescription:
Teton Gravity Research presents

PRESSURE DROP

Film Screening


All ticket holders are eligible to win one of the local prizes at time of event and is required to complete the online form provided at the event. By completing the prize form, that will automatically enter each ticket holder into the TGR grand prize and will be announced at a later date. The grand prize winner will be contacted privately by the contact details they provided.


Pressure Drop is the latest chapter in a 30-year journey—born from a dream, funded by commercial fishing in Alaska, and driven by a love for life on the edge. Follow the world’s best skiers and snowboarders through massive cliffs, stacked pillows, and deep powder, from Norway to British Columbia, California, Alaska, and home in Jackson Hole, Wyoming. This film captures that split-second when fear meets flow—and celebrates the lifelong commitment to chasing the fall line.

This event is supported by Mountain Lifestyle Outlets and Big White Ski Resort.

This is an all-ages event.

description: Three-time JUNO-winning pianist, Andy Milne, performs with his jazz trio, UNISON. For over 30 years, Milne has demonstrated boundless versatility, collaborating with dancers, visual artists, poets, and musicians spanning multiple genres. His recent album, Time Will Tell, was nominated for the JUNO Award for Jazz Album of the Year.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

ANDY MILNE AND UNISON


For over 30 years, award-winning pianist and composer Andy Milne has demonstrated remarkable versatility, collaborating with dancers, visual artists, poets, and musicians across genres. With UNISON, Milne returns to his first love, the piano trio, exploring intimacy, texture, and groove. He has developed a strong musical bond with bassist John Hébert since 2010, now rounded out by drummer Clarence Penn. Their debut, The reMission (Sunnyside Records), won the 2021 JUNO Award for Jazz Album of the Year: Group. Their latest album, Time Will Tell, continues this evolution and was nominated for the same award in 2024.

A former student of Oscar Peterson, Milne is a respected force in New York’s creative jazz scene. He’s collaborated with artists like Ravi Coltrane, Bruce Cockburn, and Cassandra Wilson, and was a core member of Steve Coleman’s M-BASE Collective. Milne also composes for classical ensembles and screen, scoring projects such as Black Life: Untold Stories and several films by William Shatner. In 2024, he premiered a piano quintet with the Isidore String Quartet, commissioned by the Banff International String Quartet

Competition. Milne is a Yamaha Artist and serves as Assistant Professor of Music at the University of Michigan.

John Hébert, originally from New Orleans, has been a highly sought-after New York bassist since the mid-1990s. A former student of Rufus Reid, Hébert has collaborated extensively with pianists Fred Hersch and Andrew Hill, appearing on celebrated recordings from each pianist. He has also performed with Lee Konitz, Paul Bley, John Abercrombie, Kenny Wheeler, Paul Motian, Uri Caine, Bill Stewart, Mary Halvorson, Tomasz Stanko, David Liebman, and Toots Thielemans, among many others.

Drummer Kush Abadey has cultivated an eclectic and fast-moving career, known for his versatility across jazz, rock, and electronica. At age 16, he joined the band of Grammy Award-winning trumpeter Wallace Roney, and has since performed with leading artists including Ravi Coltrane, Chris Potter, Melissa Aldana, Cecile McLorin Salvant, Nicholas Payton, Dee Dee Bridgewater, Wynton Marsalis, Buster Williams, and more.

“The emotionally complex album that came out of that session owes much to the single-minded focus of the three players as they moved fluently through Milne’s dynamic compositions.” Downbeat Magazine

Pricing

description: Following his lineage of solo work, imbued with sobriety, abstraction, and simplicity, José Navas continues dancing his life on stage, as he has done for the last forty years. AVES is a luminous dance ritual of hope and optimism.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

AVES

by José Navas / Compagnie Flak


Words from the choreographer;

A solo show that celebrates the importance of love and art.

Following his lineage of solo work, imbued with sobriety, abstraction, and simplicity, José Navas continues dancing his life on stage, as he has done for the last forty years.

This show comprises four dance solos that will invite the audience into the personal story of José Navas and Bill Douglas. The two artists met and lived together in NYC and later Montreal, sharing life and art until the death of Douglas from AIDS in 1996. The culmination of this artistic relationship, “While Waiting” – choreographed by Douglas and performed by Navas – was recognized in 1994 with a Bessie Award (New York Dance and Performance Award).

The choreographer–soloist will perform on a simple open stage, set with three chairs. There will be movement in the space to the music of Bach, PJ Harvey, Billie Holliday, and Dorothy Moore. He renews his longstanding collaborations with light designer Marc Parent and costume designer Sonya Bayer.

AVES is a luminous dance ritual of hope and optimism, Navas’ way to pay homage to Douglas.

José Navas

A native of Caracas, Venezuela, José Navas moved to New York before settling in Montreal, where he created his first choreography in 1991. Four years later he founded Compagnie Flak. José Navas dances with intensity in solo shows charged with emotion, he constructs abstract and captivating group pieces, and he creates pieces of contemporary ballet with classicism and sensitivity. As guest choreographer for prestigious ballet companies, he created an iconoclastic version of Giselle (2013) for Ballet BC, Watershed (2013) for the National Ballet of Canada, and Dénouement/Auflösung (2015) for the German company tanzmainz. His work has been presented in 30 countries in the Americas, Europe and Asia.

For more information on Jose, click here

description: Canadian music legend Barney Bentall, known as the frontman of Barney Bentall and the Legendary Hearts, brings his storied career to the stage in a new solo performance. Featuring songs, heartfelt stories from the ranch and road, and rich visuals, this show offers an intimate musical journey.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

BARNEY BENTALL

My Life in Ranching and Rock & Roll

Canadian music legend Barney Bentall, best known as the frontman of Barney Bentall and the Legendary Hearts, brings his storied career to the stage in a powerful new solo performance. Blending songs, heartfelt stories from the ranch and road, and captivating visuals, this intimate show offers a rare glimpse into the life of one of Canada’s most celebrated singer-songwriters.

Over the course of his career, Barney has earned a Juno Award for Most Promising Group of the Year, multiple Juno nominations, Canadian Country Music Association awards, and induction into both the Canadian Music Hall of Fame and the BC Entertainment Hall of Fame. These accolades reflect his contributions across decades of work in rock, country, and folk, not just his solo material, but his full journey through Canada’s musical landscape.

From the artist:
People often ask if I am going to write a book about my life. Well… this performance is my attempt to tell the story. To tell it in a way that works for me.

Through the spoken word, through my songs and with lots of visuals…. the beautiful landscapes of life on the ranch along with scenes taken from a life lived on stage, backstage, on the road and in front of a microphone.

I hope you enjoy it.

Imagine an evening that is somewhere between Clarkson’s Farm and Springsteen on Broadway.

For more information visit: https://www.barneybentall.com

RCA Theatre Member sales start Thursday, September 18, 2025.
General public sales start Thursday, September 25, 2025.

description: Charlie Demers is a JUNO-nominated, award-winning, comedian, author, and actor and a star of CBC’s smash hit, The Debaters. He will perform an evening of stand-up comedy with host Faris Hytiaa and local comedian, Alison Lujan.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

CHARLIE DEMERS


Juno Nominated Stand-Up Comedian
BC Book Prize Nominated Author
Co-Star of 2 Emmy-Winning Netflix Animated Series

Charlie Demers is a comedian, author, actor, playwright, screenwriter and political activist. He's joined by host, Faris Hytiaa, and local comedian, Alison Lujan. Charlie Demers is a beloved regular on CBC Radio’s The Debaters, reaching over 750,000 listeners weekly. He’s performed at Just for Laughs and on national TV and radio. His books include Vancouver Special, a Hubert Evans Prize finalist, and Property Values. His latest mystery novel, Noonday Dark, follows Primary Obsessions in the Dr. Annick Boudreau series, exploring mental health through a psychological lens. Charlie’s second comedy album, I Hope I Don’t Remember This My Whole Life (2022), followed his Juno-nominated debut Fatherland, solidifying his reputation as one of Canada’s sharpest, most versatile comedic voices.

Faris Hytiaa is a rising Canadian comic known for honest storytelling and sharp crowd work. Born in Toronto and raised in Alberta, his unique voice earned him Telus STORYHIVE’s first comedy special, SEND HELP. He’s appeared at Just for Laughs, CBC’s Halifax and Winnipeg Comedy Festivals, and Moncton’s HubCap Festival. By year four, he’d played every major televised comedy fest in Canada. Faris debuted on The Debaters in 2024 and has toured nationally, opening for acts like Hasan Minhaj and Neal Brennan. His laid-back style and unpredictable wit make him a standout in Canada’s comedy scene.

Alison Lujan is an Okanagan-based comedian whose vibrant stage presence and deeply personal storytelling have won over audiences across the region. After dropping out of a writing program in 2012, she spent a decade gathering experiences that now fuel her comedy, from heartbreak to hilarity. In 2023, she returned to the mic and quickly made a name for herself with a style that’s surreal, uplifting, and raw. Whether reflecting on absurd real-life moments or embracing the awkwardness of being human, Alison’s humour sparks conversation long after the set ends.

description: Ché Aimee Dorval offers an immersive cinematic journey where trip-hop, airy dream pop, and laid-back electronica drift together with a touch of alt-indie edge. With sleek production reminiscent of Goldfrapp, Bonobo's organic pulse, and Lana Del Rey's moody allure, Ché crafts music for those chasing city lights and after-hours reveries.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

CHÉ AIMEE DORVAL


Canadian artist Ché Aimee Dorval offers a sonic escape—an immersive cinematic journey where late-night trip-hop, airy dream pop, and laid-back electronica drift together with a touch of alt-indie edge. With sleek production reminiscent of Goldfrapp, Bonobo's organic pulse, and Lana Del Rey's moody allure, Ché crafts a soundtrack for those chasing city lights and after-hours reveries. Step into her world, where every beat paints a scene and every melody tells a story.

In 2023, Ché was featured on a haunting duet with Gord Downie (The Tragically Hip) and made guest appearances on Devin Townsend's Lightwork, setting the stage for her third solo album, The Crowned, co-produced by Bob Rock (Metallica). Clash Magazine praised the record for “fusing pop, soul, and indie elements to produce something potent and original,” while Knotfest called the standout track “Falling Under” a “timeless earworm.”

Fresh off a busy year of touring in 2024 to support The Crowned, Ché channeled her passion for alt-pop and synthwave into a new body of work that promises to push her signature sound even further. This spring, she’ll release new material that marks the next step in her ongoing evolution as an artist.

description: Cordâme performs a vibrant tribute to poetesses from the Renaissance to the present day. Composer and bassist Jean Félix Mailloux has set to music the sublime stories of timeless poets in this chamber music project infused by lyrical singing and jazz.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

CORDÂME

Fabula Femina


Cordâme performs a vibrant tribute to poetesses from the Renaissance to the present day. Composer and bassist Jean Félix Mailloux has set to music the sublime stories of Gaspara Stampa, Louise Labé, Emily Dickinson, Catherine Pozzi and Louise De Vilmorin of timeless richness. Texts dealing with love, life and death, wonder, joy and suffering. Cordâme’s musicians along with singer Coral Egan interpret these songs with great sensitivity. Rich orchestrations, dreamlike and touching poetry that will leave no one indifferent. A chamber music project infused by lyrical singing and jazz, highlighting poetesses of great talent with accuracy and sensitivity.

Cordâme is a highly dynamic ensemble dedicated to interpreting the compositions of Jean Félix Mailloux. Formed in Montreal in 2004, Cordâme explores the textures, timbre, and unique sound of strings, giving rise to evocative music. The ensemble has recorded 11 albums, including ‘Lieux imaginés,’ which won an OPUS Prize in 2013, ‘Fabula Femina’ OPUS PRIZE finalist and ‘Da Vinci inventions,’ a finalist at ADISQ in 2022. Cordâme made a significant impact with the Satie Variations tour, a finalist for the RIDEAU 2018 tour award and the winner of the Accès Culture 16-17 award, presenting over 60 performances throughout Quebec from 2016 to 2018. Actively engaged in the Canadian scene, the ensemble regularly tours in Asia and the United States. Cordâme is certainly a group to follow. Led by the prolific double bassist Jean Félix Mailloux, the ensemble promises emotionally charged concerts through their subtle and sensitive music.

“It’s sublime, magnificent, perfection, no flaws, artists with pure talents... A great record!” Jean-François Côté, Radio-Canada/CBC

Texts:
Gaspara Stampa (1523-1554)
Louise Labé (1524-1566)
Emily Dickinson (1830-1886)
Catherine Pozzi (1882-1934)
Louise de Vilmorin (1902-1969)

Music:

description: DerRic Starlight is an award-winnning Comedian Puppeteer, Writer, and Director, and works as a puppeteer with the Jim Henson Company. Dallas Arcand, a four-time world champion hoop dancer from Alexander First Nation, is a celebrated multidisciplinary artist and cultural ambassador.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

DERRIC STARLIGHT AND DALLAS ARCAND


*Please note, the time has been changed to 7:00PM

DerRic Starlight is a comedian, puppeteer, writer, and director who has spent his life performing with puppets. From writing plays and filming wrestling shows as a teen to training at The Second City Toronto and Starr Theater in Arizona, DerRic honed his craft across North America. He got his start on North of 60 at 17 and has since spent over 25 years entertaining audiences through live shows and film. A Gemini Award winner for his voice work on Wapos Bay, he recently fulfilled a lifelong dream by training and performing with The Jim Henson Company on Fraggle Rock (Apple TV).

Dallas Arcand is now a four-time world champion hoop dancer, multidisciplinary artist, and cultural ambassador from Alexander First Nation, Alberta, Canada. With over 30 years of experience, he has dedicated his life to preserving and promoting Indigenous culture through dance, music, and storytelling.

Arcand is a proud Cree from Alexander First Nation in Alberta, Canada, and delivers breathtaking performances that captivate audiences young and old. His intricate choreography, combined with his ability to weave storytelling and cultural symbolism into his dance, set him apart in a highly competitive field. Arcand’s performances demonstrate true agility and perseverance while showcasing the evolution of hoop dance as a dynamic and living Indigenous art form.

For more information and enquiries, CLICK HERE

description: Musicians Trina Basu and Arun Ramamurthy perform stunning, meditative violin duets that draw on Indian classical music, Western chamber music, and jazz improvisation. Vidya Kotamraju performs Maktub: Ashes to Alchemy, a dance that blends classical Indian movement, voice, and visuals into a contemporary ritual of loss and becoming.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

FLUX

Trina Basu & Arun Ramamurthy/Vidya Kotamraju


Musicians Trina Basu and Arun Ramamurthy perform stunning, meditative violin duets that draw on Indian classical music, Western chamber music, and jazz improvisation. The performance is preceded by Maktub: Ashes to Alchemy, a dance choreographed and performed by Vidya Kotamraju.

Husband and wife violinists Trina Basu and Arun Ramamurthy reimagine the possibilities of string chamber music. Their sound is intimate yet expansive, rooted in South Indian classical music, Western classical traditions, and jazz. Their improvisational fluency allows their violins to intertwine seamlessly, creating music that feels both ancient and contemporary.

Their debut album, Nakshatra (SPINSTER 2023), named after the Sanskrit word for constellation, explores the balance between individual expression and collective harmony. As The New Yorker writes, their music is “free-flowing and globe-spanning.” The Guardian calls Nakshatra “a gorgeously ruminative listen, blending the traditions of folk and South Indian Carnatic music with heavenly improvisation.”

Opening the evening is Maktub: Ashes to Alchemy, a striking solo by Vancouver-based dance artist Vidya Kotamraju. Blending Bharata Natyam, global music, and contemporary movement, the piece is inspired by The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho and shaped by themes of migration, identity, and transformation. With voice, projections, and the haunting NAVTAR® instrument, Vidya creates an emotionally charged performance that bridges tradition and innovation.

For more information, CLICK HERE
IG and FB: @vidyakotamraju

description: With Falcon's Heart, Joe Grass draws his inspiration from classic country songwriting. His songs are vivid and opalescent—Grass’s keen and heartfelt lyrics lit up by leftfield arrangements and shimmering sound. Guest Ezra Ben-Shalom performs bold, avant-folk that’s ripe for this current moment in a world longing to feel connected.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

JOE GRASS

Falcon’s Heart -

with special guest Ezra Ben-Shalom


Joe Grass has been writing his own music for almost 20 years, but since moving from Moncton to Montreal he’s become one of this city’s most sought-after musical partners, collaborating with Lhasa, Patrick Watson, Elisapie and the Barr Brothers—as well as working with his avant-pop band, Klaus. Those partnerships have taught him how to unmake a tune—picking up someone else’s idea and finding new ways to fill it in.

With his new album Falcon's Heart, he drew his inspiration from classic country songwriting. He’d spend mornings at the rehearsal space with his father’s old guitar in his hands.

The result is vivid and opalescent—Grass’s keen and heartfelt lyrics lit up by leftfield arrangements and shimmering sound. It’s at once completely simple and utterly lush.

For more information, visit: joegrass.com

Ezra Ben-Shalom is a songwriter, vocalist, instrumentalist and producer who has had a rich and rewarding career. Ben-Shalom’s first solo album, Known and Unknown, is set to be released in spring 2025. Ben-Shalom translates from Hebrew as “son of peace.” A desire to build connection and community is at the heart of the project. Known and Unknown may be the most meaningful and heartfelt work of his career to date. A bold, avant-folk record drenched in Jewish tradition and ripe for this current moment in a world longing to feel connected.

Ben-Shalom has released seven albums with various ensembles, been nominated for a JUNO Award, won a Western Canadian Music Award, and performed on stages across North America. His work has been featured by broadcasters across much of the English-speaking world. Along the way he’s collaborated with Canadian icons, having sung a duet with Bif Naked and played banjo with Tegan and Sara.

Ben-Shalom is part of a movement of contemporary Jewish artists strengthening their community and building bridges of shared humanity with a wider audience. Ben-Shalom understands the desire to probe the deepest mysteries and to search for meaning in our lives as a universal human experience. Ben-Shalom views his music as an act of engaging with the oral tradition of his ancestors. His songs place him in a lineage of storytelling that stretches back to the beginnings of shared human thought. Diving into this rich tradition has had a profound impact on Ben-Shalom.

Pricing

MONTREAL GUITAR TRIO

Christmas Around the World


The Montreal Guitar Trio (MG3) surprises, amazes, exalts, and ignites audiences with their dynamic and breathtaking stage presence. This passionate trio has been sharing their work with fervor for over 25 years. In addition to their three guitars, these multi-instrumentalists also sing and play the violin, mandolin, bass, accordion and more.

These three brilliant guitarists (Sébastien Deshaies, Glenn Lévesque and Marc Morin) have brought together some of the best music to celebrate Christmas in their own ingenious, unique, and unbeatable way: The Nutcracker (Tchaikovsky), The Nightmare Before Christmas (Danny Elfman), A Charlie Brown Christmas (Vince Guaraldi) and other titles!

description: Set in a universe of domestic trappings and interlocking stories, People Watching’s creation ‘Play Dead’ observes the beautiful, twisted and sometimes laughable facets of the human experience. Through its dynamic hybrid of acrobatics, movement and physical theatre, the piece puts forth a surrealist chronicle of the familiar.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts and Living Things present

PLAY DEAD


Set in a universe of domestic trappings and interlocking stories, People Watching’s new creation ‘Play Dead’ observes the beautiful, twisted and sometimes laughable facets of the human experience. Through its dynamic hybrid of acrobatics, movement and physical theatre, the piece puts forth a surrealist chronicle of the familiar. But far from settling into bored fatalism, this show marvels at the absurdity of the mundane and celebrates life, the same way people desperately dance to the last song before the party ends.

People Watching is a collective comprising six multidisciplinary artists currently based in Montreal. Each personally established in their field, they have worked for companies such as The 7 Fingers, Circa, Cirque du Soleil and Jacob Jonas the Company. Founded in the tumultuous spring of 2020, they were initially moved to investigate ways in which intimacy could be shared with an audience during a time of profound seclusion.

The inquisitive nature of this creative process led them to fuse their organic acrobatic research with elements of physical theatre and nuanced choreographic work. By providing the awe-inspiring qualities of contemporary circus with a scaffolding of depth and context, People Watching began to establish a body of work that is intimate and inherently human.

Using live performance, film, and photography as a vehicle for their artistic endeavors, they have found local and international recognition, which in turn has fostered collaborations with a multitude of established creatives and companies. Additionally, the collective continues to facilitate workshops while touring, allowing them to foster a cultural exchange with fellow artists and share some of the physical language and performance methods they have developed in the creation of their personal work.

“Not only did the six Montreal artists from People Watching give us the festival's favorite show, but they also created one of the most remarkable contemporary circus shows in recent years.”

“The fact remains that this collective takes us elsewhere. Without circus apparatus and without words, it makes us smile and moves us. These six artists, who have the ambition to reinvent the circus of tomorrow, have just raised the bar high. Remember their names.” La Presse; Circus Reinvented

For more information, CLICK HERE

description: Punch Line, a solo work by Jacques Poulin-Denis, borrows as much from the comedic style of a one man show as it does from the intimacy and depth of a confession. In the guise of an artist talk, Poulin-Denis shares his takes on life and loses himself in thought.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts and Living Things present

PUNCH LINE

by Jacques Poulin-Denis and Grand Poney


Co-presented with the Living Things International Arts Festival.

Punch Line, a solo work by Jacques Poulin-Denis, borrows as much from the style of stand-up comedy as it does from the intimacy and depth of a confession. In the guise of an artist talk, Poulin-Denis embodies a kaleidoscope of possible characters, fragmented and intercut, meticulously choreographed and absolutely unexpected. Joyful, ironic, insightful and humorous, he reveals himself slowly, then abruptly, and hovers between the reality of a human body and the fictions it can manifest. Poulin-Denis materializes our inner monologues, then shifts the frame.

A 'punchline' is, of course, the culmination of a joke. The set-up gets us thinking one thing and then hits us where we weren’t expecting it. Punch Line is a salute to the imagination of both artist and spectator; to the beauty and insight in our collective imagination.

For more information, CLICK HERE

description: For the last twenty-five years, Rudresh Mahanthappa’s music has constantly pushed at the artistic boundaries to encompass such diverse inﬂuences as classic bebop, the ﬂash and fury of electric fusion, and the complexities of Carnatic music, while always maintaining a clear sense of his own ﬁercely intelligent, uncompromising musical personality.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

RUDRESH MAHANTHAPPA'S

Hero Trio


Hailed by Pitchfork as “jaw-dropping… one of the finest saxophonists going,” alto saxophonist, composer and educator Rudresh Mahanthappa is widely known as one of the premier voices in jazz of the 21st century. He has over a dozen albums to his credit, including the acclaimed Bird Calls, which topped many critics’ best-of-year lists for 2015 and was hailed by PopMatters as “complex, rhythmically vital, free in spirit while still criss-crossed with mutating structures.” His album Hero Trio was considered to be one of the best jazz albums of 2020 by critics and fans alike. Rudresh has been named alto saxophonist of the year for nine of the last eleven years running in Downbeat Magazine’s International Critics’ Polls (2011-2013, 2015-2018, 2020-1), and for five consecutive years by the Jazz Journalists’ Association (2009-2013) and again in 2016. He won alto saxophonist of the year in the 2015-2018 & 2020 JazzTimes Magazine Critics’ Polls and was named the Village Voice’s "Best Jazz Artist" in 2015. He has also received the Guggenheim Fellowship and the Doris Duke Performing Artist Award, among other honors, and is currently the Anthony H. P. Lee ’79 Director of Jazz at Princeton University.

"Mahanthappa's trio convincingly puts a distinctive stamp on the eclectic source material, with sparkling cocktails of hooks, groove and solos that unfurl in structures that can be straight and not so straight." Jazzwise Magazine (Editor's Choice)
For more information, CLICK HERE

Saxophonist Darren WIlliams will perform an opening set of original solo compositions. Darren Williams is a Canadian saxophonist/bassoonist who pushes the limits of extended instrumental technique into regions that are lyrical, terrifying, uncanny, and “more fun than spiked punch live” (Georgia Straight). Called “a raw, vocal explorer,” (Stuart Broomer) Darren has performed with Eugene Chadbourne, Chad van Gaalen, John Oswald, Mats Gustafsson, Han Bennink, and many others.

For more information, CLICK HERE

description: Tina Leon is a singer-songwriter from Montreal who draws her inspiration from the Motown generation and the soul music of the last decades. Having already sung and collaborated with Stevie Wonder, DJ Champion and Garou under the artist name Marie-Christine Depestre, she now appears in a new light, more authentic and full of life than ever.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

TINA LEON


Tina Leon is a singer-songwriter from Montreal who draws her inspiration from the Motown generation and the soul music of the last decades. Having already sung and collaborated with Stevie Wonder, DJ Champion and Garou under the artist name Marie-Christine Depestre, she now appears in a new light, more authentic and full of life than ever. In reference to the nickname given to her by her family and in homage to her maternal grandmother, this choice of a new stage name is a way for her to fully express her personality, to assert her art and thus to find a form of balance.

Describing herself as a rainbow of soul, her first EP "Push" (August 26, 2022, via Ensoul Records) is a colorful journey through jazzy, funk, and pop rhythms with rich and enchanting melodies.

"Tina Leon is a rising star in the R&B and Neo Soul genres whose music has the ability to uplift and inspire. She keeps drawing crowds in and securing her position in the Canadian music scene with her distinctive sound and heartfelt performances. Watch out for this budding star as she makes waves with her moving songs and amazing skill." - Viberate

For more information, visit tinaleonofficial.com

Pricing

description: Canada’s longest-running professional choir, the Vancouver Chamber Choir performs True North, a selection of choral works by composers from Canada, Estonia, Denmark, Latvia, and other northern countries. Each work, conducted by Kari Turunen, is inspired by the unique landscapes of northern regions.
htmlDescription:
Rotary Centre for the Arts presents

VANCOUVER CHAMBER CHOIR

True North


The Vancouver Chamber Choir, conducted by Kari Turunen, performs True North, a selection of choral works by composers from Canada, Estonia, Denmark, Latvia, and other northern countries. Each work is inspired by the unique landscapes of northern regions.

Artistic Director Kari Turunen began leading the Vancouver Chamber Choir, Canada’s longest-running professional choir, in September 2019, its 49th concert season. Jon Washburn founded the choir in 1971 and it has become an amazing success story, ranking with the handful of North America’s best professional choruses and noted for its diverse repertoire and performing excellence. The choir has presented concerts to audiences at home in Vancouver and on tour across Canada. International excursions have taken them to the USA, Mexico, Japan, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, South Korea, Finland, France, Germany, the Czech Republic, Russia, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Ukraine.

Honoured with the Margaret Hillis Award for Choral Excellence by Chorus America, the choir has performed countless concerts and broadcasts, released 36 recordings and received numerous awards. Foremost supporters of Canadian music, they are responsible for commissions and premieres of 334 choral works by 145 composers and arrangers, most of whom are Canadian. Over the years the choir has sung over 4,000 performances of works by Canadian composers, in addition to their extensive international repertoire.

Program
Bo Holten, Regn og rusk og rosenbusk (depending on Abby’s availability)
Stuart Beatch, Girl hours
Pēteris Vasks, Piedzimšana
Eriks Ešenvalds, Rivers of Light
Andrew Balfour, Qilak
Nico Muhly, Rough notes
Veljo Tormis, Sügismaastikud
armen Braden, Crooked by nature
R. Murray Schafer, Epitaph for Moonlight / Snowforms

Pricing
